boardgame.name: RAF: Lion vs Eagle
RAF: The Battle of Britain 1940
boardgame.description: The Battle of Britain, 1940_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;RAF: The Battle of Britain 1940 is three games in one, on history's greatest air campaign:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;RAF:LION updates the classic original solitaire game -- you control the RAF against the German raiders. All systems have been updated to reflect recent scholarship, notably the fatigue and patrol systems. Advanced rules cover late interception, VHF-equipped squadrons and evasion tactics, Ace squadrons, Forward Airfield Targets, Delayed RAF Response and more!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;RAF:EAGLE reverses the solo game -- you control the Luftwaffe planning and executing raids against the RAF. Also, you flip the map over for a German perspective on the campaign. Advanced rules include, High Command requirements, deep targets, Jabos and special rules for Ju-87 Stukas._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;RAF: 2-PLAYER allows for head-to-head play. A separate German planning display is added to allow the German player to plan his raids in secret._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Each game has its own complete rules booklet._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Contents:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;176 Die Cut Counters_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;165 Cards_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 34_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; x 22_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; Maps_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;3 Rule Booklets_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 Player German Planning Board_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 Combat Damage Sheets (Double-Sided)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 Miscellaneous Player Aids (Double-Sided)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1 Sequence of Play Sheet (Double-Sided)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1 Battle of Britain Historical Guide (reprinted from S_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp;T Magazine #256)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2 6-sided dice_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Storage Bags_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Decision Games (DCG 1019) ALL NEW EDITION: SOLITAIRE _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; TWO-PLAYER RAF: Lion vs Eagle _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; -- Winston Churchill France has fallen. England stands alone against the might of a triumphant Germany, defended only by the Spitfire and Hurricane squadrons of the Royal Air Force. Hitler orders his mighty Luftwaffe to destroy the RAF in preparation for Operation Sealion - the invasion of England. German fighters and bombers fill the English skies and the RAF responds. Now you command the RAF or the Luftwaffe in history_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s greatest air campaign - the Battle of Britain. Improving on his award winning solitaire classic, designer John Butterfield ramps up the historical accuracy, tension and play options with three complete games. RAF: Lion puts you in control of British Fighter Command, responding to German raids. The game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s unique card system generates targets and forces, which may remain hidden until after you commit your squadrons. Your foe is no mindless system: the Luftwaffe has priorities and a strategy. Scenarios range from one raid day, taking an hour to complete, to the full campaign, playable in 12 hours. RAF: Eagle puts you in control of the Luftwaffe forces raiding England. You schedule raids and assign missions to your bombers and fighters, attempting to deliver the knockout blow. Can you take out the British radar system and cripple their aircraft production? The game controls the RAF response to your strategies. How does a foe so close to defeat keep coming back? RAF: 2-Player pits you against a live opponent, one controlling Fighter Command and the other the raiding Luftwaffe forces. Historical features include: German high command priorities, close escort, free hunt, the Channel Patrol, Jabos, day and night bombing, radar, the Observer Corps, weather, ULTRA intercepts, squadron patrols, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;big wings,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; altitude advantage, ace squadrons and flak. Game Contents: • 176 5/8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Counters • Two 34x22_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Full-Color Game Maps (printed back to back) • German Planning Board • 165 Cards • Three Rules Booklets • Historical Study Booklet • Player Aid Cards • Two Dice Game Scale: Time: each game turn equals a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;raid day_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; with six two-hour segments. Units: British squadrons and German Gruppen. Map: one inch equals 20 miles (32 kilometers). Players: one or two.

This is an engaging solitaire game. You can either play as the Luftwaffe commander or the RAF commander. There is even a 2 player version so it is actually 3 games in one. I found the Eagle version the most challenging as Luftwaffe commander. It gives you the scope to decide on raid targets and time of day as well as the number of aircraft for each raid, all within some realistic restrictions. The RAF fighter defence is a tough nut to crack. Typically they know you are coming and can mass squadrons accordingly. They also get their fighters down and refuelled and rearmed within 2 to 4 hours. You must be clever and creative with your raid strategy. For example you might send in a small well escorted raid to an airfield to draw the enemy fighters and then follow up with a devastating much larger raid to catch them on the ground. You have to decide whether to allocate your Me 109 fighters to hunt in large groups for enemy fighters or keep them close to protect the vulnerable bombers. As the Luftwaffe you cannot afford heavy losses and yet you must engage the RAF in big aerial battles to defeat them. Time is also against you with Operation SeaLion looming in mid September. In contrast as the RAF player you have to deal with dwindling numbers of experienced pilots. You typically have plenty of replacement aircraft but green pilots are very vulnerable in battle. The game is in great condition. I have included a GMT counter tray and some extra photocopies of some of the charts for convenience.
